place.name: OAKHILL
place.gazetteerText: OAKHILL, a chapelry in Ashwick, Shepton-Mallet, and Stoke-Lane parishes, Somerset; 2 miles N E of Shepton-Mallet. It has a post-office under Bath. Pop., 445. The living is a vicarage. Value, £164.* Patron, the Rector of Shepton. The church was built in 1862. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
